content: houseplant blanket 🌱 🌿 🪴 🌱 🌿 🪴 🌱 🌿 🪴 🌱 🌿 🪴 🌱 🌿 gauge 24 sts x 32 sts is 4 in 10 cm in stockinette st 🌱 🌿 🪴 🌱 🌿 🪴 🌱 🌿 🪴 🌱 🌿 🪴 🌱 🌿 notions tapestry needle scissors 🌱 🌿 🪴 🌱 🌿 🪴 🌱 🌿 🪴 🌱 🌿 🪴 🌱 🌿 techniques used double knitting reading color work chart please note as with all double knitting projects each square on the color work chart represents two stitches - the stitch that you will see on the side you are currently working and the stitch that will appear on the opposite side of your work please familiarize yourself with how to read a chart design for double knitting before attempting to get far with this blanket a baby blanket for little blooming plant lovers double knit so that any which way will look put as always when knitting with a chart please together and cozy finished size is 42 in x 37 5 in remember that it is read from right to left and from bottom to top there are numbers denoting 🌱 🌿 🪴 🌱 🌿 🪴 🌱 🌿 🪴 🌱 🌿 🪴 🌱 🌿 the row and columns on the chart for your guidance yarn mc cream 1300 yds // 1200 m // 300 g 🌱 🌿 🪴 🌱 🌿 🪴 🌱 🌿 🪴 🌱 🌿 🪴 🌱 🌿 cc green 1300 yds // 1200 m // 300 g pattern cast on 504 sts in total - 252 sts in the mc and fingering weight 75% pima cotton 25% acrylic 252 sts in the cc set up for double knitting test knit completed with mc knitpicks comfy in for guidance this video shows numerous ivory cc knitpicks comfy in peapod techniques to cast on for double knitting - i utilized the long tail double knit cast on for this 🌱 🌿 🪴 🌱 🌿 🪴 🌱 🌿 🪴 🌱 🌿 🪴 🌱 🌿 project but feel free to do what feels comfortable for you and your project https // needles www youtube com/watch v=2iwi2jipmbm 3 mm circular needle follow along the chart as written paying attention to which colors you are knitting with for each respective side of the blanket after the chart is complete follow along with this double needle bind-off https // www youtube com/watch v=qkvlkjfglbe 🌱 🌿 🪴 🌱 🌿 🪴 🌱 🌿 🪴 🌱 🌿 🪴 🌱 🌿 finishing weave in all ends if using washable yarn highly recommended especially if this blanket is for a baby messes are a part of life machine wash cold and tumble dry low otherwise if using other yarn hand wash and lay flat to dry please reach out if you have any questions or concerns i d love to see your finished knits -
